name: 5th Sun
description:
The legend states that, before this world existed, the gods gathered in Teotihuacan to figure out what to do with the world as it was unstable. There had been 4 suns (what we consider "eras") before  ours and each had ended by a flood, fire rains and other catastrophes. The Gods gathered around a fire and realized that they needed a sacrifice. A young and buff god, Teocicuiatl, volunteered himself as sacrifice but backed out as he got closer to his death. This caused great dishonour amongst the gods. Nanahuatzin, an old and wise god, offered himself and all of his cacao for this ritual and did not hesitate. He ran across the “Boulevard of the Dead” and stepped into the fire pit. At that moment, the sun came out from the East. Filled with shame, Teocicuiatl stepped into the fire and a smaller sun appeared next to the Sun. The gods, who were angry at him, could not allow him to shine as much as the honourable Nanahuatzin. They looked around, saw a rabbit and threw it to the smaller Sun, turning it’s fire out and permanently scarring it into the Moon. That is why the moon (in Mexico) has a rabbit shape encrusted in it.

Yet, there was still unstability in the world dor neither the Sun or the Moon moved. The Gods realized they all had to sacrifice for the stars to move and hence, bring us life.

In this game, you must collect all the cacaos you can find in the great ancient city of Teotihuacan. You move the camera with the mouse, move your character with the WASD and Arrow Keys. Use the space bar to jump and enjoy the scenary.

There is much to be done to finish this game.
